summary:
CAD, or heart disease, happens when plaque builds up in the heart's arteries, slowing blood flow. It's the world's top cause of death. Symptoms include chest pain, shortness of breath, or no symptoms at all. Risk factors are high blood pressure, smoking, diabetes, and more. Tests like ECG and blood tests help diagnose it.

To prevent and treat CAD, eat healthily, exercise, maintain a healthy weight, and avoid smoking. Medications and procedures like stents or bypass surgery can also help. In 2015, CAD affected 110 million people globally.
title: Coronary artery disease
